Append the OEM event handler to standard handler is better solution I think. For one event type, OEM event will only handle the event for some specific sensors. The others one still can be handle by the standard handle.

Fixed. revert the code change here and modify the for loop to continue invoke appended handlers even the handler return ERROR.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/63028/13/libpldmresponder/platform.cpp#347
No code use this method.
Ack
The properties/signals in xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Threshold.threshold.Warning/Critical interface should be updated also.

These property or signals of threshold/value dbus interface for numeric sensor are updated by sensor polling task because numeric sensor value changes quicker than threshold event. So it should unnecessary to update sensor value and threshold at here.

There are two solutions to create Threshold event log.
1. Read sensor value, check the read value with warning/critical threshold values to create the threshold event.
2. Handle the NumericSensorState, check eventState value to identify the event
eventState values : { Unknown, Normal, Warning, Critical, Fatal,
LowerWarning, LowerCritical, LowerFatal,
UpperWarning, UpperCritical, UpperFatal }
When method create threshold signal, the sensor sel/redfish event log will auto create.

As far as I know, it is done by phosphor-sel-logging service.
The function here would be useful if the BMC FW has no IPMI support. Should we make the handler of sensor event to be optional?

Section 14.1 in DSP0248 V1.2.2, "The Initialization Agent function is responsible for initializing PLDM sensors and effecters and
1427 setting Event Receiver location information into the termini."
The setEventReceiver should be set after GetPDRs.
Done
